instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1297: What is A1297? A1297 is a model number for a 17 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Early 2009, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011 with EMC 2272, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2390, 820-2610, 820-2849, 820-2914..
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B that had a bad GPU and so I disabled it, and removed <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR>. Now it has display with the intel graphics.

However, the mac, when on battery only, keeps rebooting when we send it to shutdown. Even unplugin the charger, makes the mac to power on.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message:
Did you disable it in BIOS, or flashing GMUX?
Does it turn off correctly with charger alone, or charger and battery both connected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message:
Hi, I disabled it in BIOS (medusa).
With charger connected (alone or with the battery), it works normally. However, after I shut it down (with battery and charger connected), when I disconnect the charger, it powers on by it self.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message: If you work on battery alone and shut it down, will restart instead?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message:
Hi,

Yes, thats exactly that what happends.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message:
Had this behavior before touching BIOS?

Resolder <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> and do PRAM reset.
Check if turns off correctly with GPU enabled.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message:
Hi,

I didnÂ´t cheked it before touching BIOS. However, after restoring GPU (with <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR>), it has the same behavier.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message:
Hi,
I've already tried with a known good battery, but had the same result.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1297</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B won't shutdown
threads.message: Check if PCH's RTC signals are correct and stable.
